intro.title: Hi !
text: I'm Sylvain Boulade, a web developer from Toulouse (France).
I'm currently focusing mainly on JavaScript and modern front-end technologies.

articles.name: about
articles.title: About me
text: After studying computer science at Paul Sabatier university in Toulouse, I found (about 6 years ago) a job as programmer for Harris Interactive (now a part of Toluna group), a market research company based in Paris. It was a whole new life and experience for me to work there and live in Paris.

About 3 years ago, I had an opportunity to come back to my home town of Toulouse (following my partner who was starting new studies there), and I kept working for the same company remotely for about 2 years as a "Technical consultant" (not that the title really matters). While working there, I acquired a strong experience in front-end web development, but also in project management, mentorship, contractors handling, and more.

Last year I felt it was time for a change and I had the exciting opportunity to join Occitech as a web developer where I have been working mainly on a product called Front-Commerce whose goal is to drastically improve the way e-commerce sites are built by providing a pluggable and modern front-end layer (a GraphQL middleware and a React SPA/PWA)  on top of existing e-commerce solutions. I have learned a lot working on this ambitious project along with the Occitech team.

I am very enthusiastic and curious in general, but particularly about programming. I love learning new things and challenging what I know and learn. The pace at which front-end technologies have been evolving these past few years make them a very good fit for me. This is not to say that I don't enjoy other aspects of programming, and I am always open to new opportunities.

articles.name: code
articles.title: Code / Projects
text: The main language I use is JavaScript (along with CSS of course), and while I don't think a long list of libraries and frameworks is particularly useful, I will mention that I am gravitating a lot around the React ecosystem these days (this means that I commonly use tools like yarn/npm, webpack, babel, jest...).

Even though most of my paid work can't be showcased, I really like using some of my free time to hack on personal projects, and try my hand at technologies that I find interesting. Most of them will be on github, and some recent examples can be seen below.

projects.author: front-commerce
projects.name: FC-Lite
projects.desc: The open-source, lightweight version of Front-Commerce

projects.author: hihuz
projects.name: Meny
projects.desc: A recipe sharing / editing app, a personnal project in progress

projects.author: hihuz
projects.name: sb
projects.desc: The code for this very website

articles.name: misc
articles.title: Other stuff
text: When I'm not working, I can very often be found writing code for personal projects, reading articles, watching talks and workshops, and following the latest front-end trends on my twitter feed.

Besides programming, I enjoy playing classical music on my piano. I took lessons for more than ten years when I was a kid, and after a very long break I have started playing again about two years ago. I confess a soft spot for Beethoven.

I also like to relax playing video games on my PC (Hearthstone mostly these days, even though I have played a copious number of games in the past), reading novels, watching movies and shows, listening to music, running and cooking.
Please reach out if you want to know more about me.
